summary: This document is an email chain from December 16, 2021, regarding the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. It includes a forwarded message from attorney Gerald N. Silver notifying an FBI agent that his office represents an individual (likely a victim or witness referred to as 'Gamia') and instructing that all future communications be directed to the attorney.

persons.name: Gerald N. Silver
persons.context: Attorney who sent an email to an FBI agent stating his office represents an individual (likely 'Gamia') in the Ghislaine Maxwell case and directing all communications to his office.

connections.description: Gerald N. Silver states in his email that his law office represents an individual referred to as 'Gamia' in the context of the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Attorney Notification to FBI
events.description: Attorney Gerald N. Silver sends an email to an FBI agent, formally notifying them that his office represents a client (referred to as 'Gamia') in the Ghislaine Maxwell case and that all communications must go through his office.

locations.address: 21201 Victory Boulevard, Suite 200, Canoga Park, CA 91303-2866
locations.context: The address of the Law Offices of Gerald N. Silver.

keyFacts: An attorney, Gerald N. Silver, formally notified the FBI that his office represents an individual (likely a victim or witness) in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The communication instructs the FBI to cease direct contact with the client and to direct all future communications concerning the case to the attorney.
The document is part of the legal correspondence surrounding the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell, indicating ongoing witness/victim representation and coordination with law enforcement.
